name: Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act
description: Federal law strengthening HIPAA enforcement expanding breach notification requirements extending compliance to business associates and providing incentives for EHR adoption.
authority: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
parent_framework: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)

name: Improved Health Information Technology
description: Subtitles covering enhanced privacy and security provisions testing of health information technology grants and loans funding and enforcement mechanisms.

name: Medicare and Medicaid HIT
description: Medicare and Medicaid incentives for meaningful use of certified EHR technology and EHR adoption for eligible healthcare providers.

name: Improved Privacy and Security Provisions
description: Enhanced HIPAA privacy and security protections extended business associate liability tiered penalties breach notification requirements and expanded enforcement authority.

name: Testing of Health Information Technology
description: EHR certification standards testing procedures for certified systems and ONC authority to certify electronic health record technology.

name: Grants and Loans Funding
description: Financial resources for EHR adoption workforce training funding and health IT infrastructure support to promote electronic health record adoption.

name: Privacy and Security Provisions (Enforcement)
description: Enforcement mechanisms tiered civil monetary penalties enhanced OCR authority business associate direct liability breach notification requirements and safe harbor provisions.
